innhold.avsnitt: Deadline for postponing the father or co-motherâ€™s benefit period

If you do not want to start the parental benefit period immediately after the mother has finished her parental benefit period, you must apply to postpone the benefit period. You must send the application at the latest on the last day the mother receives parental benefit. If you are applying to postpone your benefit period until a later time, you will have fewer days of parental benefit.
If only the father or co-mother is entitled to benefit

If the mother is not entitled to parental benefit, the father or co-mother may apply to start his/her parental benefit period from week seven after the child was born. In connection with adoption, the father or co-mother can start his/her parental benefit period from the day on which care of the child was assumed.
If you start your benefit period later, you get fewer weeks of parental benefit.
